item.title: Lua Ternary Idiom
item.description: Lua Ternary Idiom You can find ternary operators in other languages in the following form: d = a ? b : c Ternary by Precedence. In Lua logical operators and their precedence can be used to achieve the same: d = a and b or c Written out with if it would look like this: if a then d = b else d = c end If a is true then b will be assigned to d.

item.title: Tables in Pico8
A CPU in Lua
item.description: A CPU in Lua This post was originally published on blog.headchant.com but was edited and moved here in 2022. It might be interesting to implement a small register based VM in Lua. Lets start by considering the architecture of a register machine. The NOP machine If we look at how existing Register Machines are designed for example the or the Lua VM itself, we see a few things: some registers a program something that executes the program The last part will be the point of entry for the lua program itself but also decide the core features of the design.
